item.title: Maryam add a quote by Freddie Mercury
item.description: "My soul has painted like the wings of butterflies, Fairy tales of yesterday will grow but never die, I can fly, my friends..." -- Freddie Mercury

item.title: Maryam add a quote by Freddie Mercury
item.description: "I'm just a musical prostitute, my dear." -- Freddie Mercury

item.title: Maryam add a quote by Freddie Mercury
item.description: "I'm very emotional; I think I may go mad in several years' time." -- Freddie Mercury

item.title: Maryam add a quote by Freddie Mercury
item.description: "Who wants to live forever? " -- Freddie Mercury

item.title: Maryam add a quote by Freddie Mercury
item.description: "I always knew I was a star, and now the rest of the world seems to agree with me." -- Freddie Mercury

item.title: Maryam add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "But I think the first real change in women’s body image came when JLo turned it butt-style. That was the first time that having a large-scale situation in the back was part of mainstream American beauty. Girls wanted butts now. Men were free to admit that they had always enjoyed them. And then, what felt like moments later, boom—Beyoncé brought the leg meat. A back porch and thick muscular legs were now widely admired. And from that day forward, women embraced their diversity and realized that all shapes and sizes are beautiful. Ah ha ha. No. I’m totally messing with you. All Beyonce and JLo have done is add to the laundry list of attributes women must have to qualify as beautiful. Now every girl is expected to have Caucasian blue eyes, full Spanish lips, a classic button nose, hairless Asian skin with a California tan, a Jamaican dance hall ass, long Swedish legs, small Japanese feet, the abs of a lesbian gym owner, the hips of a nine-year-old boy, the arms of Michelle Obama, and doll tits. The person closest to actually achieving this look is Kim Kardashian, who, as we know, was made by Russian scientists to sabotage our athletes." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Maryam add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "He had just about enough intelligence to open his mouth when he wanted to eat, but certainly no more." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Maryam add a quote by John Cheever
item.description: "I can’t write without a reader. It’s precisely like a kiss—you can’t do it alone." -- John Cheever

item.title: Maryam add a quote by John Cheever
item.description: "I've been homesick for countries I've never been, and longed to be where I couldn't be." -- John Cheever

item.title: Maryam add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Maryam add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Maryam add a quote by Isaac Marion
item.description: "All the shitty stuff people do to themselves... it can all be the same thing, you know? Just a way to drown out your own voice. To kill your memories without having to kill yourself." -- Isaac Marion

item.title: Maryam add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz
